data_maturity_score.evidence: Mentions workflow managers (Airflow, Dagster), data quality tools (Great Expectations, Soda), and Databricks - indicating defined processes but no advanced governance or MLOps

data_maturity_level.evidence: Matches score of 3 - documented processes with modern tools but no evidence of optimization or data mesh

maturity_signals.evidence: Explicitly mentions Airflow, Dagster, Great Expectations, Soda, Databricks - modern tools for orchestration and quality

scope_creep_score.evidence: Focused on data modeling, pipeline development, and infrastructure - no conflation with ML, analytics, or DevOps roles

overtime_risk_score.evidence: Onsite work in Seoul with no PTO mentioned, but no explicit 'fast-paced' or 'wear many hats' language

role_clarity.evidence: Specific requirements for SQL, Python, workflow managers; focused on data modeling and infrastructure

overall_red_flag_score.evidence: Low risk - well-defined DE role with clear requirements, no scope creep, moderate overtime risk

reporting_structure_clarity.evidence: No information about reporting manager or team structure in job posting or Pass 1/2

manager_level_inferred.evidence: No managerial titles or reporting structure mentioned anywhere in the job posting

team_growth_velocity.evidence: No information about team size changes or hiring velocity in job posting

team_composition.evidence: No details about team size, composition, or seniority levels provided

reporting_structure.evidence: No information about who the role reports to or organizational structure

cross_functional_embedded.evidence: No mention of working with product teams, PMs, or cross-functional collaboration; appears to be centralized data team

work_life_balance_score.evidence: Onsite work in Seoul with no PTO or work-life balance mentions; no negative signals but limited positive indicators

growth_opportunities_score.evidence: Mentions 'growth opportunities' but no specific career paths, learning budget, or mentorship programs

tech_culture_score.evidence: Modern tools (Airflow, Databricks) and data quality focus suggest decent engineering practices, but no CI/CD or testing culture mentioned

tech_culture_signals.evidence: No mention of open source, tech blogs, conference speaking, hackathons, or innovation time

dev_practices_mentioned.evidence: No explicit mentions of code review, CI/CD, monitoring, incident response, or design docs

innovation_signals.evidence: No information about R&D time, experimentation culture, or new tech exploration

tech_debt_awareness.evidence: No mention of tech debt management, refactoring, or code quality improvement initiatives

ai_integration_level.evidence: No ML/AI mentioned in job posting; LLM/GenAI explicitly false in Pass 1; no ML tools beyond Databricks mentioned

ml_tools_expected.evidence: No ML-specific tools mentioned beyond Databricks (which is general data platform)

hiring_urgency.evidence: No 'ASAP', 'immediate start', or urgency language in job posting

competition_level.evidence: No application count, location competitiveness, or salary competitiveness indicators available

company_stage_inferred.evidence: Mention of OCMP (One Core Multi Platform) and focus on scaling suggests established tech company rather than startup

hiring_velocity.evidence: No information about hiring pace, multiple roles, or expansion plans

team_size_signals.evidence: No information about data/engineering team size provided

funding_stage_signals.evidence: No funding stage, investor information, or financial status mentioned

role_creation_type.evidence: No indication whether this is a new headcount, backfill, or team expansion

strength_details: Strong modern data stack (Airflow, Databricks, Great Expectations)
Clear focus on data modeling and pipeline development
Well-defined requirements for SQL, Python, and workflow managers
concern_details: No salary information disclosed - compensation unknown
Onsite work in Seoul with no work-life balance signals
No information about team structure or reporting lines
best_fit_details: Mid-level engineers with 3-5 years experience in data modeling and ETL
Candidates with experience in Airflow, Dagster, or similar workflow managers
Engineers comfortable with onsite work in Seoul and Korean market
probe_details: Ask about actual team size and composition of the data engineering team
Inquire about who the role reports to and team structure
Clarify expected work hours and any on-call requirements
leverage_details: Experience with Databricks and data quality tools (Great Expectations) is valuable
Strong SQL and Python skills with workflow manager experience are key differentiators
summary.overall_assessment: Solid opportunity for mid-level data engineers seeking to work with modern data tools in a Korean tech company. Clear role focus on data modeling and pipelines with good tooling. Main concerns are lack of compensation transparency, no work-life balance signals, and unclear team structure. Best suited for candidates comfortable with onsite work in Seoul.
